headline: Easy Corn Salsa
description: A quick and easy colorful salsa made with canned sweet corn, bell pepper, jalape√±o, red onion, and cilantro. Perfect for when you need salsa now!
name: Easy Corn Salsa
recipeIngredient: 1 tablespoon chopped fresh cilantro, or more to taste
1 tablespoon fresh lime juice, or to taste
salt and black pepper to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Stir corn, bell pepper, red onion, jalape√±o, cilantro, lime juice, honey, crushed red pepper, salt, and pepper together in a bowl. Chill until ready to serve.

review.reviewBody: This recipe is a hit with the family. We have had it on fish and chicken as well as with tacos and fajitas. I added a can of black beans, use the juice of a whole lime and used only half of the onion since they have been very hot.

I love corn (born in Iowa) and this was yummy. Doubled the lime juice and honey, and cut back on the onion. Thought it didn‚Äôt have a salsa texture to it so have been using as a salad with lunches! üëç
I didn‚Äôt have a orange pepper, but I used a red jalape√±o and a green jalape√±o. I used 3 ears of sweet dot fresh corn.I boiled the corn then cut off the kernels.
This dish is very bomb !!! Very colorful with burst of flavor. It was fajita night & I wanted a corn salsa from scratch. Definitely a bold taste & I plan to perfect this simple recipe again

I made it and it was a huge hit. I used left over fresh corn and about a half a can chopped green chili's instead of cilantro. I also doubled the honey, but I had also used large onion, red pepper, and a great big jalapeno! We had it with pork carnita's and a pot of pint beans, man o man!
I make this salsa ALL the time. So easy, and so tasty. Sometimes I mix it with a simple bean salad recipe and just have a bowlful for lunch!
Put in half the onions! Would definitely not put in the whole onion. Good, easy recipe.

Refreshing side that would go well with Mexican dishes, fish or by itself. I'll have to go light-handed on the crushed red pepper, as it had too much of a bite for me. It definitely needs the honey to offset all of the spiciness. I used a steamed, fresh ear of corn that equaled about the same amount in the can mentioned. The fresh cilantro from a plant I purchased recently worked nicely.
This is awesome! So simple to make. I did omit to bell peppers though. The best part, if you‚Äôre on Weight Watchers this is 0 points!! But you have to watch the chip intake. Enjoy!
I add a little bit of limeade concentrate into this and it adds just a little more sweetness!
Would double the corn, double the lime juice, half the onion and even then it was good but not great so 4 stars for how mine turned out and -1 star for adjustments

I get tired of the same old salsa, so I whipped this up for my family to enjoy. They loved it! We had it with tortilla chips, and I also topped a baked potato with it. The only changes I made were to leave out the jalapeno pepper but that's just because I'm not a fan. Thanks for sharing this great recipe!
extra lime, added some fresh parsley because it's going crazy in my garden. very fresh and tasty
No changes needed. Was perfect jus the way it was written! Will definitely make this again! Thanks for the great recipe.

I'm rating this 5 stars because, if you make it to taste the way YOU like it, it's worth it.
It's not 5 stars as written (more like 3) because, even though she said she didn't measure, 1 whole onion and 1 whole pepper are too much for 1 can of corn. 
Here's what I used and I think it will be awesome after the flavors meld overnight (but it tastes great now):
1 can no sugar or salt added corn (I don't normally buy this kind, but I wanted to season the salsa to my liking)
1/4 of a large red bell pepper, diced small
1/4 of a medium sweet onion (didn't have red), diced small
1/2 of a medium jalapeno pepper, seeds removed, minced (might use more next time)
Approx 1 tsp crushed red pepper (didn't measure this)
2 tbsp chopped cilantro
Juice of 1/2 lime
Approx 1 tsp light blue agave (don't have honey)
Kosher salt & fresh cracked pepper to taste
After tasting it, as much as I love onion (even raw), I decided to add 1/2 Can of black beans (rinsed and drained) to mellow out the onion a bit.
I'm looking forward to eating this tomorrow because I think it is going to taste light and refreshing with a bit of heat - perfect for summer and July 4th weekend. Enjoy!
Excellent recipe and super easy to make! My husband loves it and wants to have it again soon. I did make one change. I didn't have an orange pepper, so I used a red one. This recipe is a keeper.

Wonderful recipe, and super quick. A great accompaniment to tacos, burritos, and quesadillas. My only complaint is that I find this more a good 'base' recipe, than a complete recipe in an of itself. It's made infinitely better by the addition of some chopped avocado, a few dashes of hot sauce, and perhaps some black beans. You really could customize it however you like. Over all though, very good!
This salsa is quick, easy and tastes SO good! I added a can of black beans or you can add kidney too. Huge hit at football parties and tailgating with Tostitoes scoops!

Delicious and flavorful! I tried a sample after making it and it was refreshingly delightful! I used a 16 oz bag of frozen white corn instead of the canned ones and just thawed before mixing everything together. I varied the serving to eight (to bring to the office potluck) and put in fresh juice of an entire lime. I like the spicy kick to it, the festive color, and crunchiness. I made it the evening before the lunch potluck and I think that helped seep the flavor. My co-workers enjoyed it a lot and asked for the recipe so I shared this! I am really happy and proud to have this recipe guidance and execute successfully. Very simple and easy!
This was so easy and I had everything on hand. I caught my father in law eating it with a spoon.
This has become my and my wife's favorite salsa. Absolutely perfect with carnitas.
It was fast and easy, the only thing I added was tomatoes!
Very good. Put with mexican chicken
I needed a quick and easy corn salsa and this recipe fit the bill. Awesome!
This was amazing! I used white corn on the cob, instead of canned corn.

This is a great easy recipe! I have never made corn salsa before so wasn't sure if I would like it.I did change it a little with variations of 1/4 c yellow onion (didn't have a red),1/2 can black beans rinsed and drained,1 teaspoon sugar (didn't have any honey), 2 Tablespoons lime juice, 1 Tablespoon cilantro spice,& 1 teaspoon red pepper flakes.I took it to work and my co-workers loved it. Great with chips,or to use to cook chicken or salmon on the grill. The leftover I used on top of my turkey tacos!

I made this to serve over the top of some fried zuchinni cakes that I made from zuchinni that I had picked fresh from my garden. I also used some fresh grilled corn instead of canned. I also used a pinch of cumin. It was great! I plan on making this again in the future to try as a topping with tacos.
Very flavorful. The only thing I skipped was the orange bell pepper...just not a fan. My sister in law loved it and practically licked her plate clean! Certainly a keeper!!

This recipe has just become part of a very tasty "accidental" meal. The story: It all started with some homemade coleslaw that I wanted to use up, so I planned to make pulled pork sandwiches. I put a boneless pork loin in the crock pot, sprinkled it with garlic powder, onion powder, salt and pepper,doused it with a cup of red wine vinegar and cooked it for 6 hours on high. I made some homemade bbq sauce, but the pork was sooooooo good without it, I decided to go a different route. I tossed a little of the crock pot juices in with the pork which I had shredded. I served it on top of some super easy cilantro-lime rice. It was really good, but it needed something. This salsa was the something it needed. It was very easy to throw together with on-hand ingredients. I happened to have some fresh lemons and strawberries so I made lemonade with mottled strawberries, which complemented this meal perfectly. When summer corn appears, I will try this recipe with some fresh corn, but it is surprisingly good with the canned stuff. The only thing better about going to Chipotle is they don't make me clean the kitchen!

This corn salsa is awesome. I squeezed half a lime in it. Also, it's even better when it sits in the fridge. I guess the juices soak in better once it sits. It is really great and I've made it several times now to go on salad with chipotle marinated chicken breast.
Very good recipe! We ended up adding in an extra can of corn and doubled the lime juice as it blended better with our tastes.

I made this with (ok, more like I did the work and he stirred the ingredients) my bf for a potluck at his work. I just got a text that said "everyone loved it, you did good!" (lol) I just made a few tiny changes: 1) subbed red pepper for orange 2) added half a can of black beans 3) used closer to two tbs lime juice 4) subbed a chili pepper for jalapeno (what we had) 5) subbed garlic salt for regular salt. THANKS FOR SHARING! :)

Loved this! I can't give it 5 stars because I changed it a lot based on what I had in the cupboard, but it was a great base to work from. Used a can of corn, minced red onion, chopped red pepper, fresh cilantro, lemon juice and crushed red pepper. It was delish! Will definitely make again.

VERY good and EASY corn salsa recipe. Like others have mentioned this is a very close replica if you are trying to make burrito bowls similar to what is served at Chipotle's Restaurant. Thanks so much for sharing this recipe, Jeannine!

This recipe is SIMPLE! Beter, it's DELICIOUS!
I made it with leftover corn that I cut off the cob and actually ate it for breakfast this morning!
Thanks!
What a beautiful side dish! I was trying to find a way to use up a few leftovers and your recipe was simply perfect. We love it.

Great recipe. Our oldest daughter is vegitarian and loves Chipotle's salad with their corn salsa. She was home from college this weekend so I made this for her while we had tacos. It was amazing! I doubled the recipe and we still had none left. Will definately make this again...Can't wait to have fresh corn and peppers from the garden to make this then. Thanks for the recipe Jeannine.

I made this last night and my family and I LOVED it! We love to eat at Chipotle restaurant, so I made the chicken and steak bowls that they serve. My husband made the remark, "you've got Chipotle beat with these bowls!" My two year daughter (I made some without the jalape√±o for her), ate without her spoon and licked her hands clean! LOL! That made me feel soooo good! Thanks for a grrrrrrreat recipe! ;- D
I was looking for a corn salsa like what is served at Chipotle, and this is really close. We like our salsa with a bigger kick and added an extra jalapeno pepper. Really good!

I made this to add to chicken tacos and overall it was great! I used half of red and orange bell peppers to add a little more flavor and color. I also added half a can of black beans and one extra tablespoon of lime juice. VERY YUMMY!
Good recipe & very easy to make. I would reccomend a small red onion or 1/2 of a medium red onion. Served with fish tacos and it was a hit!
We made this to serve with white corn chips and it was very good. Nice alternative to typical tomato salsa!

refreshing! I left out the jalapeno and only used 1/2 an onion, used an entire lemon, and made it a little special by adding some shrimp (cooked quickly on a pan with a little oil and then cut into small pieces). Had it with pita bread for a light lunch.

This recipe is great! I added more lime juice, cilantro, and a red pepper to give it a stronger flavor and more color. I made it as a side to my main dish for the night and my boyfriend and I loved it so much we couldn't stop eating.
